page.title: 11NEWLANDS SCHOOL
page.content: NEWLANDS SCHOOL IS VERY OLD. IN 1976 WE CELEBRATED OUR CENTENARY WITH AN EXHIBITION AND ACTIVITIES. THERE HAVE BEEN 7 HEADTEACHERS AND OVER 1000 CHILDREN ENROLLED DURING THE PAST 100 YEARS. AT NEWLANDS WE WILL SOON HAVE OVER 50 CHILDREN AS WE AMALGAMATE WITH LAMANCHA AND KIRKURD SCHOOLS. WE WILL NEED 3 PRIMARY TEACHERS. AT THE MOMENT WE HAVE 3 VISITING SPECIALIST TEACHERS, 1 FOR ART, 1 FOR CRAFT AND 1 FOR MUSIC. WE ALSO HAVE A TEACHER WHO HELPS OUT FOR HALF A DAY PER WEEK AND AN AXILIARY FOR 1 WHOLE DAY. THE HEADTEACHER TEACHES THE OLDER CHILDREN AND DOES THE OFFICE WORK AS WELL. CHILDREN BEGIN SCHOOL AT 5 YEARS OF AGE AND LEAVE AT 11 TO GO TO HIGH SCHOOL IN PEEBLES. ABOUT HALF OF OUR CHILDREN WALK TO SCHOOL, THE OTHERS COME BY CAR OR BUS.
